Package utilities¶

Settings¶

This module contains project wide settings.

cmstoolsac3b.settings.mc_samples()[source]¶

Returns a dict of all MC samples.

cmstoolsac3b.settings.data_samples()[source]¶

Returns a dict of all real data samples.

cmstoolsac3b.settings.data_lumi_sum()[source]¶

Returns the sum of luminosity in data samples.

cmstoolsac3b.settings.create_folders()[source]¶

Create all “DIR” prefixed folders.

Looks up all string members starting with DIR (e.g. DIR_LOGS) and produces folders in the working dir according to the string.

cmstoolsac3b.settings.get_pretty_name(key)[source]¶

Simple dict call for names, e.g. axis labels.

cmstoolsac3b.settings.get_fill_color(sample_or_legend_name)[source]¶

Gives a ROOT color value back for sample or legend name.

cmstoolsac3b.settings.get_stack_position(sample)[source]¶

Returns the stacking position (integer)

class cmstoolsac3b.settings.StyleClass[source]¶

Sets all ROOT style variables. Places self as new ROOT style.

root_style_settings()[source]¶

All custom style settings are specified here and applied to self.

Decorator¶

class cmstoolsac3b.decorator.Decorator(target, deep_decoration=True)[source]¶

Implements the decorator pattern. For a basic outline, have a look at http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decorator_pattern However, in python, no subclassing and no getters/setters are needed, thanks to __getattr__ and __setattr__.

>>> class Foo(object):
...     def f1(self):
...         print "in Foo.f1()"
...     def f2(self):
...         print "in Foo.f2()"
>>> class FooDecorator(Decorator):
...     def f2(self):
...         print "in FooDecorator.f2()"
...         self.decoratee.f2() # VERY IMPORTANT !! pass on the call...
>>> x = Foo()
>>> y = FooDecorator(x)
>>> y.f1()
in Foo.f1()
>>> y.f2()
in FooDecorator.f2()
in Foo.f2()
get_decorator(name)[source]¶

Runs over all inner decorators, returns the one according to ‘name’.

insert_decorator(new_dec)[source]¶

Inserts decorator right after me.

replace_decorator(old, new_dec)[source]¶

Changes old for new in the chain of decorators.

remove_decorator(old)[source]¶

Searches ‘old’ and removes it.

print_decorators()[source]¶

For debugging.

Singleton¶

class cmstoolsac3b.singleton.Singleton(*args, **kws)[source]¶

Use as metaclass! Example use in utilities/monitor.py .

Monitor¶

class cmstoolsac3b.monitor.Messenger[source]¶

Message stub. Used to connect to Monitor.

This class eliminates the need for other classes to subclass PyQt4.QtCore.QObject if messaging is wanted.

class cmstoolsac3b.monitor.Monitor[source]¶

Interface for system outputs.

Can be interfaced to a future GUI. Therefore the PyQt Signal and Slot Mechanism is used.
